trailingComments.value:
*
 * The `IndexPage` component displays the index page, including the welcome
 * hero, the sidebar, and the discussion list.
If the user is returning from a discussion page, then take note of which
discussion they have just visited. After the view is rendered, we will
scroll down so that this discussion is in view.

leadingComments.value: If the user is returning from a discussion page, then take note of which
discussion they have just visited. After the view is rendered, we will
scroll down so that this discussion is in view.

trailingComments.value: If the user is coming from the discussion list, then they have either
just switched one of the parameters (filter, sort, search) or they
probably want to refresh the results. We will clear the discussion list
cache so that results are reloaded.

leadingComments.value: If the user is coming from the discussion list, then they have either
just switched one of the parameters (filter, sort, search) or they
probably want to refresh the results. We will clear the discussion list
cache so that results are reloaded.
Compare the requested parameters (sort, search query) to the ones that
are currently present in the cached discussion list. If they differ, we
will clear the cache and set up a new discussion list component with
the new parameters.
Save the scroll position so we can restore it when we return to the
discussion list.

trailingComments.value: Work out the difference between the height of this hero and that of the
previous hero. Maintain the same scroll position relative to the bottom
of the hero so that the sidebar doesn't jump around.

leadingComments.value: Work out the difference between the height of this hero and that of the
previous hero. Maintain the same scroll position relative to the bottom
of the hero so that the sidebar doesn't jump around.

trailingComments.value: Scroll to the remembered position. We do this after a short delay so that
it happens after the browser has done its own "back button" scrolling,
which isn't right. https://github.com/flarum/core/issues/835

leadingComments.value: Scroll to the remembered position. We do this after a short delay so that
it happens after the browser has done its own "back button" scrolling,
which isn't right. https://github.com/flarum/core/issues/835

trailingComments.value: If we've just returned from a discussion page, then the constructor will
have set the `lastDiscussion` property. If this is the case, we want to
scroll down to that discussion so that it's in view.

leadingComments.value: If we've just returned from a discussion page, then the constructor will
have set the `lastDiscussion` property. If this is the case, we want to
scroll down to that discussion so that it's in view.

   * Build an item list for the sidebar of the index page. By default this is a
   * "New Discussion" button, and then a DropdownSelect component containing a
   * list of navigation items.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

comments.value:
*
 * The `IndexPage` component displays the index page, including the welcome
 * hero, the sidebar, and the discussion list.
If the user is returning from a discussion page, then take note of which
discussion they have just visited. After the view is rendered, we will
scroll down so that this discussion is in view.
If the user is coming from the discussion list, then they have either
just switched one of the parameters (filter, sort, search) or they
probably want to refresh the results. We will clear the discussion list
cache so that results are reloaded.
Compare the requested parameters (sort, search query) to the ones that
are currently present in the cached discussion list. If they differ, we
will clear the cache and set up a new discussion list component with
the new parameters.
Save the scroll position so we can restore it when we return to the
discussion list.
Work out the difference between the height of this hero and that of the
previous hero. Maintain the same scroll position relative to the bottom
of the hero so that the sidebar doesn't jump around.
Scroll to the remembered position. We do this after a short delay so that
it happens after the browser has done its own "back button" scrolling,
which isn't right. https://github.com/flarum/core/issues/835
If we've just returned from a discussion page, then the constructor will
have set the `lastDiscussion` property. If this is the case, we want to
scroll down to that discussion so that it's in view.

*
   * Get the component to display as the hero.
   *
   * @return {MithrilComponent}

*
   * Build an item list for the sidebar of the index page. By default this is a
   * "New Discussion" button, and then a DropdownSelect component containing a
   * list of navigation items.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Build an item list for the navigation in the sidebar of the index page. By
   * default this is just the 'All Discussions' link.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Build an item list for the part of the toolbar which is concerned with how
   * the results are displayed. By default this is just a select box to change
   * the way discussions are sorted.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Build an item list for the part of the toolbar which is about taking action
   * on the results. By default this is just a "mark all as read" button.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Return the current search query, if any. This is implemented to activate
   * the search box in the header.
   *
   * @see Search
   * @return {String}

*
   * Redirect to the index page without a search filter. This is called when the
   * 'x' is clicked in the search box in the header.
   *
   * @see Search

*
   * Redirect to the index page using the given sort parameter.
   *
   * @param {String} sort

*
   * Get URL parameters that stick between filter changes.
   *
   * @return {Object}

*
   * Get parameters to pass to the DiscussionList component.
   *
   * @return {Object}

*
   * Open the composer for a new discussion or prompt the user to login.
   *
   * @return {Promise}

*
   * Mark all discussions as read.
   *
   * @return void

tokens.value:
*
 * The `IndexPage` component displays the index page, including the welcome
 * hero, the sidebar, and the discussion list.
If the user is returning from a discussion page, then take note of which
discussion they have just visited. After the view is rendered, we will
scroll down so that this discussion is in view.
If the user is coming from the discussion list, then they have either
just switched one of the parameters (filter, sort, search) or they
probably want to refresh the results. We will clear the discussion list
cache so that results are reloaded.
Compare the requested parameters (sort, search query) to the ones that
are currently present in the cached discussion list. If they differ, we
will clear the cache and set up a new discussion list component with
Save the scroll position so we can restore it when we return to the
Work out the difference between the height of this hero and that of the
previous hero. Maintain the same scroll position relative to the bottom
of the hero so that the sidebar doesn't jump around.
Scroll to the remembered position. We do this after a short delay so that
it happens after the browser has done its own "back button" scrolling,
If we've just returned from a discussion page, then the constructor will
have set the `lastDiscussion` property. If this is the case, we want to
scroll down to that discussion so that it's in view.

*
   * Get the component to display as the hero.
   *
   * @return {MithrilComponent}

*
   * Build an item list for the sidebar of the index page. By default this is a
   * "New Discussion" button, and then a DropdownSelect component containing a
   * list of navigation items.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Build an item list for the navigation in the sidebar of the index page. By
   * default this is just the 'All Discussions' link.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Build an item list for the part of the toolbar which is concerned with how
   * the results are displayed. By default this is just a select box to change
   * the way discussions are sorted.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Build an item list for the part of the toolbar which is about taking action
   * on the results. By default this is just a "mark all as read" button.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * Return the current search query, if any. This is implemented to activate
   * the search box in the header.
   *
   * @see Search
   * @return {String}

*
   * Redirect to the index page without a search filter. This is called when the
   * 'x' is clicked in the search box in the header.
   *
   * @see Search

*
   * Redirect to the index page using the given sort parameter.
   *
   * @param {String} sort

*
   * Get URL parameters that stick between filter changes.
   *
   * @return {Object}

*
   * Get parameters to pass to the DiscussionList component.
   *
   * @return {Object}

*
   * Open the composer for a new discussion or prompt the user to login.
   *
   * @return {Promise}

*
   * Mark all discussions as read.
   *
   * @return void
